tweet: And, NCI reflects the diversity of our country and world. More than 22 countries are represented on NCI's campus. There is a real fear that the President's erratic and racist behavior is pushing the world's best researchers to China and other countries. We can't let that happen.

And, it's not just government jobs. The research conducted at NCI means real private sector jobs in our communities. NCI developed unituxin, an antibody that targets neuroblastoma, and it's now licensed to a Maryland company that is creating jobs and saving lives.
When we increased funding in the last fiscal year, NCI purchased a machine to facilitate T cell therapy that saves 24 lives a year. More money for research = lives saved. It's as simple as that.
I am more convinced than ever that we need to double the budget for @NIH. We aren't funding life-saving research because of penny pinchers in Congress and that's a damn shame.

One of the two Ebola antibodies was developed in Frederick at NCI.

The first blood test for AIDS was developed in Frederick at NCI.

It was a special honor to spend some time with the researchers who are doing the scientific work no one else in the world can or is doing to cure cancer, HIV/AIDS, and other diseases. pic.twitter.com/ARtPZwNw2z
It is not hyperbole to say that the @theNCI and the @FredNatLab for Cancer Research have saved millions of lives in American and across the globe. It is a fact. pic.twitter.com/Qaua4NgDSM

The team @Starbucks in Frederick has some great people with great values. Yesterday I learned about educational benefits, inclusive hiring practices, and the art of making a good cup of coffee from some of the best.

I proudly voted in support of the #RaiseTheWageAct and I will continue to fight for legislation that will put money back in the hands of America's working families.

We must increase paychecks and revitalize the middle class -- and that starts with raising the federal minimum wage to $15 per hour. Not only does this stimulate the economy, but it is simply the right thing to do.

Working families are suffering, unable to bear the costs of living and unable to participate in our economy. This is simply unacceptable that we are allowing our families to be financially crushed by an out-of-date minimum wage.

The last time the federal minimum wage was increased was over 10 years ago on July 24th, 2009. To this day, the federal minimum wage has remained stagnate at $7.25, despite the effects of inflation and economic growth.

This is beyond unacceptable. We must take immediate action to preserve and restore the Chesapeake Bay and protect our planet for future generations. https://wtop.com/maryland/2019/08/data-confirms-growing-dead-zone-in-chesapeake-bay/ …

Today we honor Purple Heart recipients for their bravery in action and dedication to our country. Congress will continue to fight for our service members who sacrifice so much to keep us safe. #PurpleHeartDay

When I ran for Congress, I made a promise to take action on gun safety. I intend to keep that promise, but we need your help to get it done. 

Make your voice heard. Demand action. (7/7)

In short:
✅Universal background checks
✅Close dangerous loopholes
✅Ban assault weapons & large magazines
✅“Red flag" laws to keep guns out of dangerous hands
✅ Prevent and investigate domestic terrorism
✅Track and thwart dangerous white nationalist groups online (6/7)

And, we need to pass legislation to ensure the Dept of Justice and law enforcement have the tools and resources necessary to prevent, investigate, and combat domestic terrorism and violent white supremacist and nationalist groups. (5/7)

But, we can't stop there. The Congress needs to take up and pass legislation to ban assault weapons and large magazines and a law to help keep guns out of the hands of those who are deemed to be a threat to themselves or others. (4/7)
All Americans need to raise their voice and demand the Senate send the bipartisan background checks bill to the President's desk TODAY. (3/7)

Time is of the essence. We have seen this show before. After a tragedy, @realDonaldTrump endorses taking action on gun safety legislation and then reverses course when the corporate gun lobby rears its head. (2/7)

Today, 214 House Democrats sent a letter to @senatemajldr demanding he bring the Senate back into session to pass the bipartisan bills on his desk that would strengthen background checks and close dangerous loopholes. (1/7)

As we commemorate this historic legislation, it's clear that today voting rights for so many - especially people of color - are still under attack. (1/3)
